p: Egg is rich in phosphorus, calcium, potassium, and contains moderate amounts of sodium (142 mg per 100 g of whole egg) ( Table 3). It also contains all essential trace elements including copper, iron, magnesium, manganese, selenium, and zinc ( Table 3), with egg yolk being the major contributor to iron and zinc supply. The presence of such minerals and micronutrients in egg is quite interesting as a deficiency in some of these (Zn, Mg, and Se) has been associated with depression and fatigue [ 59] and development of pathological diseases. The concentration of some of those trace elements (selenium, iodine) may be significantly increased depending on henâ€™s diet (See Section 4.2).
